attributes.comment:
As a potential grandparent, I like to complain about the potentialUSCIS increase
in fees. Just to clarify, the fees are increasing for all the petitions at USCIS - not
just for adoption. Keeping that in mind, we are recommending that the fees for
adoption should be held because, for many of us, we have to file TWICE because
the approval is only good for 18 months. With adoptions taking longer and longer,
most of us have to file again as they do not permit us to renew our filing. They
make us pay the full price again!

Here is what it costs to file with USCIS for a couple just to adopt:

What it used to be when adoptions took place within 18 months:

I600A: $545

Fingerprints: $70 x 2 = $140

Total: $685

What it will be now that adoptions are taking longer plus the increase:

I600A: $670 x 2 = $1340

Fingerprints: $80 x 4 = $ 320

Total: $1660

That's an increase of $975 or over 140%! That's how much more USCIS will
make on just us, adopting parents, with no increase in services.

And that's not even taking into consideration the fact that applying for our
children's Certificate of Citizenship (for IR4 visas) goes from $215 to
$460, a difference of $245 or about 120% increase. Sometimes, we don't even
get the certificates for a year after filing!

Please consider this proposal and take into consideration the young people who
are waiting for about 2 years to get their little girls from China and then they have
to reapply again and the extra cost is considerable.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Ann Thompson
